creditline: The Robert C. Winton Fund and gift of funds from Constance Kunin
description: short hide cape with hook at neck and bottom fringe; brown cloth trim at neckline, blue silk trim at front opening; scrolling organic foliate design beadwork with four stars separating foliate motifs; multicolored beads with slight predominance of pink beads
text: The Dakota or the Metis tribe created this cape; both are known for their exquisite floral beadwork. With its interconnecting abstract flowers and leaves, the beadwork reflects a combination of Great Lakes/Woodlands and Plains floral styles.  The original purpose of this object is not entirely clear.  It may have been created for a woman, but many Metis men in Canada wore coats that incorporated a cape, and this object may have been recycled from such a coat.
title: Cape
